page.title: 16LIFE STYLES 6
page.content: Weeley has a reasonable number of facilities for the people living there. Weeley bakery makes all of its own bread. It takes 3 to 4 hours each morning to make all the bread. Half way up The Street, opposite the Police Station, is an old bus stop. It was erected in 1951 and has the inscription "Rest Ye Awhile, Then Carry On". There is a 30 mile an hour (MPH) speed limit in The Street which the residents like, but they say that not every driver obeys this rule. Most people that we talked to said that they liked Weeley as a small village and would not like to see development in the area. The shopkeepers especially did not like the new Â£1 coin, because it is too much like the 5p in shape.
